VlanService¶

public class VlanService¶

Methods¶

addToSetOverlap¶

public Set<Integer> addToSetOverlap(Set<Integer> overlap, Set<Integer> other)¶

Iterate through the set of overlapping VLAN tags, keep the elements in that set which are also contained in every IntRange passed in.

Parameters:
  • overlap –
    • The set of overlapping VLAN tags.
  • other –
    • Another set of VLAN tags, to be overlapped with the current overlapping set.
Returns:

The (possibly reduced) set of overlapping VLAN tags.

buildAvailableVlanIdMap¶

public Map<String, Set<Integer>> buildAvailableVlanIdMap(Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, List<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap)¶

createReservedVlanList¶

public List<ReservedVlanE> createReservedVlanList(Set<ReservedVlanJunctionE> reservedJunctions, Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedEthPipes)¶

Given a set of reserved junctions and reserved ethernet pipes, retrieve all reserved VLAN objects within the specified schedule period.

Parameters:
  • reservedJunctions –
    • Set of reserved junctions
  • reservedEthPipes –
    • Set of reserved ethernet pipes

createReservedVlanListFromJunctionsPipesRepo¶

public List<ReservedVlanE> createReservedVlanListFromJunctionsPipesRepo(Set<ReservedVlanJunctionE> reservedJunctions, Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedEthPipes, Date start, Date end)¶

Given a set of reserved junctions and reserved ethernet pipes, retrieve all reserved VLAN objects from Repo within the specified schedule period and from the reserved junctions/pipes.

Parameters:
  • reservedJunctions –
    • Set of reserved junctions
  • reservedEthPipes –
    • Set of reserved ethernet pipes

findEdgeSetPerVlanID¶

public Map<Integer, Set<TopoEdge>> findEdgeSetPerVlanID(Set<TopoEdge> edges, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, Map<String, Set<Integer>> availVlanMap)¶

Traverse the set of edges, and create a map of VLAN ID to the edges where that ID is available

Parameters:
  • edges –
    • The set of edges.
  • urnMap –
    • Map of URN name to UrnE object.
Returns:

A (possibly empty) set of VLAN tags that are available across every edge.

findMaxValidEdgeSet¶

public Set<TopoEdge> findMaxValidEdgeSet(Set<TopoEdge> availableEdges, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, List<IntRange> vlans, Map<String, Set<Integer>> availVlanMap)¶

Return a pruned set of edges where the nodes on either end of the edge support at least one of the specified VLANs. A map of URNs are used to retrive the reservable VLAN sets from nodes (where applicable). Builds a mapping from each available VLAN id to the set of edges that support that ID. Using this mapping, the largest set of edges that supports a requested VLAN id (or any VLAN id if none are specified) is returned.

Parameters:
  • availableEdges –
    • The set of currently available edges, which will be pruned further using VLAN tags.
  • urnMap –
    • Map of URN name to UrnE object.
  • vlans –
    • Requested VLAN ranges. Any VLAN ID within those ranges can be accepted.
  • availVlanMap –
    • Map of UrnE objects to a List<> of available VLAN tags.
Returns:

The input edges, pruned using the input set of VLAN tags.

findSetCover¶

public Set<Integer> findSetCover(Map<String, Set<Integer>> validVlanMap)¶

getAvailableVlanIds¶

public Set<Integer> getAvailableVlanIds(String urn, Map<String, Set<ReservedVlanE>> resvVlanMap, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap)¶

Get all VLAN IDs available at a URN based on the possible reservable ranges and the currently reserved IDs.

Parameters:
  • urn –
    • The currently considered URN string
  • resvVlanMap –
    • A mapping representing the Reserved VLANs at a URN
Returns:

Set of VLAN IDs that are both supported and not reserved at a URN

getIntRangesFromString¶

public List<IntRange> getIntRangesFromString(String vlans)¶

Given a list of strings, convert all valid strings into IntRanges.

Parameters:
  • vlans –
    • Requested VLAN ranges. Any VLAN ID within those ranges can be accepted.
Returns:

A list of IntRanges, each representing a range of VLAN ID values parsed from a string.

getIntegersFromRanges¶

public Set<Integer> getIntegersFromRanges(List<IntRange> vlans)¶

Return all of the VLAN ids contained within the list of VLAN ranges.

Parameters:
  • vlans –
    • Requested VLAN ranges. Any VLAN ID within those ranges can be accepted.
Returns:

The set of VLAN ids making up the input ranges.

public List<ReservedVlanE> getReservedVlansFromEthernetPipes(Set<ReservedEthPipeE> reservedPipes)¶

Retrieve all Reserved VLAN IDs from a set of reserved pipes.

Parameters:
  • reservedPipes –
    • Set of reserved pipes
Returns:

A list of all reserved VLAN IDs within the set of reserved pipes.

getReservedVlansFromJunctions¶

public List<ReservedVlanE> getReservedVlansFromJunctions(Set<ReservedVlanJunctionE> junctions)¶

Retrieve all reserved VLAN IDs from a set of reserved junctions

Parameters:
  • junctions –
    • Set of reserved junctions.
Returns:

A list of all VLAN IDs reserved at those junctions.

public List<ReservedVlanE> getReservedVlansFromRepo(Date start, Date end)¶

Get a list of all VLAN IDs reserved between a start and end date/time.

Parameters:
  • start –
    • The start of the time range
  • end –
    • The end of the time range
Returns:

A list of reserved VLAN IDs

public Set<Integer> getSetOfNumbersInRange(IntRange aRange)¶

Retrieve a set of all Integers that fall within the specified IntRange.

Parameters:
  • aRange –
    • The specified IntRange
Returns:

The set of Integers contained within the range.

getVlanRangesFromUrnString¶

public List<IntRange> getVlanRangesFromUrnString(Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, String matchingUrn)¶

Using the list of URNs and the URN string, find the matching UrnE object and retrieve all of its reservable IntRanges.

Parameters:
  • urnMap –
    • Map of URN name to UrnE object.
  • matchingUrn –
    • String representation of the desired URN.
Returns:

  • All IntRanges supported at the URN.

getVlansFromJunction¶

public List<IntRange> getVlansFromJunction(RequestedVlanJunctionE junction)¶

Get the requested set of VLAN tags from a junction by streaming through the fixtures in the junction.

Parameters:
  • junction –
    • The requested VLAN junction.
Returns:

The set of VLAN tags (Integers) requested for fixtures at that junction.

selectVLANsForJunction¶

public Map<String, Set<Integer>> selectVLANsForJunction(RequestedVlanJunctionE req_j, List<ReservedVlanE> rsvVlans, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap)¶

Select a VLAN ID for a junction. All fixtures on the junction must use their requested VLAN tag.

Parameters:
  • req_j –
    • The requested junction.
  • deviceToPortMap –
  • portToDeviceMap – @return A valid VLAN iD for each URN on this junction.

selectVlansForPipe¶

public Map<String, Set<Integer>> selectVlansForPipe(RequestedVlanPipeE reqPipe, Map<String, UrnE> urnMap, List<ReservedVlanE> reservedVlans, List<TopoEdge> azERO, List<TopoEdge> zaERO, Map<String, Set<String>> deviceToPortMap, Map<String, String> portToDeviceMap)¶

Return a mapping of URN entity to VLAN Integer ID. This map will contain the URNs of all fixtures, junctions, and ports in-between the junction.

Parameters:
  • reqPipe –
    • The requested pipe.
  • urnMap –
    • A mapping of URN string to URN entity
  • reservedVlans –
    • List of all reserved VLANs
  • azERO –
    • The AZ edges
  • zaERO –
    • The ZA edges
  • deviceToPortMap –
  • portToDeviceMap – @return Map from URN entity to VLAN ID chosen for that entity.
